flexpy.FlexPyUtil module¶

A script containing various useful functions.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.add_space_before_punctuation(s)¶

For tokenization of a text. Adds a single space on each side of every punctuation character.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.camel_case_to_snake_case(s)¶

Converts a CamelCase string to snake_case.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.convert_whitespace_to_spaces(s)¶

Replaces all whitespace characters in s with a single space.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.filter_split_token_list(lst)¶

For tokenization of a text. Takes a list of tokens and returns all non-empty and non-punctuation tokens.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_child_object(el, child_tag, tag_dict, class_name=None)¶

Gets a Python object, i.e., a class found in flexpy.tags specific to the tag of the child element.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_children(element, child_tag)¶

Gets all children, with a certain tag, of an XML element. Identical to element.findall().

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_corpus(corpus_dir)¶

Gets a corpus (list of text strings) from a directory containing .txt files. Each .txt file is assumed to correspond to a single text in the corpus.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_element_info_str(element)¶

Gets a readable string containing information about an XML element, including attributes and guid.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_frequency_dict_from_text_lst(text_lst, existing_d=None)¶

Takes an already-tokenized text, returns a dictionary of token frequencies.

Parameters

  • text_lst –

  • existing_d – a token frequency dictionary to add to, if provided

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_frequency_dict_from_tokenized_corpus(tokenized)¶

Takes an already-tokenized corpus (list of tokenized texts), returns a token frequency dictionary.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_lemma_dict(lemma_dict_fp)¶

Loads a pickle object containing a lemmatization dictionary.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_ordered_child_objects(el, tag_dict)¶

For objsur elements only. Gets ordered list of child elements as Python objects, i.e., classes found in flexpy.tags.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_pretty_concordance_formatting(conc_list, max_words_left, max_words_right)¶

Gets a readable concordance format in preparation for printing or writing to file.

Parameters

  • conc_list – the list of concordance lines. Data structure must be a list of lists. Each first-level list corresponds to a concordance line. Within each first-level list, expect three elements: list of words on left side, target word, list of words on right side.

  • max_words_left (int) – maximum number of words to include on the left side of the target

  • max_words_right (int) – maximum number of words to include on the right side of the target

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_rid_of_unicode_problems(byte_str)¶

Takes a bytes object, removes it with certain problem bytes removed.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_single_child(element, child_tag)¶

Gets the only child of an XML element with tag child_tag. If there is exactly one such child, returns it. If there are no such children, returns None. If there are more than one such child, throws an error.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_single_str_from_form(form, allow_repeat=True)¶

Gets the single string contained in a FLEx Form element. If there are no strings, returns None. If there are more than one, raises an error.

Parameters

  • form – the flexpy.tags.Form.Form object corresponding to the XML element

  • allow_repeat (bool) – (default True) Whether multiple occurrences of the same string (e.g., if it shows up as both an AStr and an AUni) should be treated as a single string. If allow_repeat is False in a case where the same string appears more than once in the Form element, the function will raise an error.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_strs_from_form(form)¶

Gets the strings from a FLEx Form element. Returns a dictionary of element type name to list of the text in such elements.

For instance, a possible return value could be {“AStr”: [“asdf”, “aoeu”], “AUni”: [], “Str”: []}, meaning that the FLEx Form element had two child elements of type AStr, containing the strings “asdf” and “aoeu”, and no child elements with other string-like types.

Parameters

form (flexpy.tags.Form.Form) –

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_strs_from_form_as_list(form)¶

Gets the strings contained in a FLEx Form element as a list, NOT in order of appearance.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_tag_class(el)¶

Gets the actual class, as a Python object, corresponding to an XML element in FLEx. This class object may then be instantiated. This is done in constructing a TagDict.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_tag_class_name(el)¶

Gets the class name for the Python object corresponding to an XML element type.

<rt class=”Xyz”> will give “RtXyz”, corresponding to the class flexpy.tags.RtXyz.RtXyz.

<objsur> elements have no such class; the referred object should be the element whose class is being created.

All other tags have a class name identical to their tag; for instance, <AUni> elements correspond to the class flexpy.tags.AUni.AUni.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_top_n_dict_items(dct, n)¶

Gets the n keys in dct which have the highest values.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.get_unique_strs_from_form_as_list(form)¶

Gets the unique strings contained in a FLEx Form element.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.lemmatize_corpus(tokenized_corpus, lemma_dict)¶

Lemmatizes an entire already-tokenized corpus (list of lists). See lemmatize_single_text().

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.lemmatize_single_text(text_lst, lemma_dict)¶

Lemmatizes an already-tokenized text according to lemma_dict, which should map from forms to their lemmas. If a form is not found, the lemma is assumed to be the form itself.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.parse_xml_with_namespaces(fp)¶

Normal XML parsing using xml.etree.ElementTree.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.parse_xml_without_namespaces(fp)¶

XML parsing which strips out namespaces. See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13412496/python-elementtree-module-how-to-ignore-the-namespace-of-xml-files-to-locate-ma

This is included because some FLEx files have elements with attribute xml:space which indicates whether whitespace should be preserved, and this causes problems.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.print_concordance_pretty(conc_list, max_words_left, max_words_right)¶

Prints a list of concordance lines in readable format. See get_pretty_concordance_formatting().

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.sort_concordance_list(conc_list, sorting_indices)¶

Sorts a concordance list.

Parameters

  • conc_list – a list of lists corresponding to concordance lines. See get_pretty_concordance_formatting() for description of this format.

  • sorting_indices – a list of ints which correspond to the positions of words in a concordance line. 0 means the target word. Negative indices mean words to the left. Positive indices mean words to the right. Thus, sorting_indices of [-1, 1, 0] would sort first by the word to the left of the target, then by the word to the right of the target, then by the target itself.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.tokenize_corpus(corpus_str_lst)¶

Tokenizes each of a list of strings. Each string is assumed to be an entire text. Returns a list of lists. First-level items are token lists for each text.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.tokenize_single_text(text_str)¶

Tokenizes a single string which contains an entire text. Removes whitespace and punctuation.

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.write_concordance_pretty(fp, conc_list, max_words_left, max_words_right)¶

Writes a concordance list to file in readable format. See get_pretty_concordance_formatting().

flexpy.FlexPyUtil.write_freq_dict_to_file(d, fp)¶

Writes a token frequency dictionary to file.

FlexPy
